required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Storage Container and Defrost Process on Components in Breast Milk
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Storage Container and Defrost Process on Components in Breast Milk

brief_summary.textblock: Breast milk is best food for neonates and preterm infants. However many handling would be done if direct breastfeeding is not feasible, and it may result in nutrients change in human milk. We investigate the influence of storage in different containers and different thawing or heating methods on human milk nutrients.

primary_outcome.measure: changes in nutrients of human milk after several processing
primary_outcome.time_frame: within first year of milk expression
primary_outcome.description: we measure the changes of nutrients, including fat, protein, lactose, energy, immunoglobulins, lactoferrin, leptin, and lysozyme in human milk after several processes, such as freezing, pasteurization, storage in different containers, thawing, and heat treatments.

study_pop.textblock: healthy mothers lactating breast milk during first year of their babies

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy mothers lactating during first year of their babies and have sufficient milk to donate
Exclusion Criteria:
- mothers who have insufficient milk for their babies
- mothers have major disease or on specific diet or drug which would affect breast milk composition

facility.name: Division of Neonatology, Department of Pediatrics, Taichung Veterans General Hospital
